block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
FILM
New Brunswick The New Jersey Film Festival, spring 2007. Schedule and information: njfilmfest.com. Through April 15. $4 to $10. New Jersey Media Arts Center, 72 Lipman Drive. (732) 932-8482.
FOR CHILDREN

Marlton ''Disney's Jungle Book and Cinderella,'' children's musical based on the Disney films. Tuesday at 10:30 a.m. and 4:30 p.m. $20 and $25. Lenape Regional Performing Arts Center, 130 Tomlinson Mill Road. (856) 983-3366. New Brunswick ''Sesame Street Live,'' children's musical. Wednesday through April 9. $10 to $26. State Theater, 15 Livingston Avenue. (732) 246-7469. South Orange ''Captain Louie,'' family musical by Stephen Schwartz, adapted from the book ''The Trip'' by Ezra Jack Keats. April 1 at 1 and 4 p.m. $18. South Orange Performing Arts Center, 1 Sopac Way. (973) 313-2787. Union Easter egg hunt for children. April 7 at noon. $2; reservations required. Liberty Hall Museum, 1003 Morris Avenue. (908) 527-0400.
MUSIC AND DANCE

Cedar Grove Bossa Brasil, Brazilian jazz. Friday, 8:30 to 11:30 p.m. Free. Giambotta, 30 Pompton Avenue. (973) 571-9484. Madison Verdi's Requiem, performed by Coro Lirico. Wednesday at 8 p.m. $20 to $30. The Presbyterian Church of Madison, 19 Green Avenue. (973) 377-1600. Morristown Cosy Sheridan with T. R. Ritchie and Arlon Bennett, folk. Friday at 7:30 p.m. $7. Minstrel Coffeehouse, Morristown Unitarian Fellowship, 21 Normandy Heights Road. (973) 335-9489. Morristown The Charlie Daniels Band, country and rock. April 7 at 8 p.m. $47 to $57. The Community Theater, 100 South Street. (973) 539-8008. Newark Liz Lerman Dance Exchange. Through April 1. $38. ''I Can't Stop Loving You: The Music of Ray Charles,'' musical revue. Tuesday through April 8. $20 to $58. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street. (888) 466-5722. Red Bank ''Songs of Life,'' by Vickie Winans, with Queeni, gospel. Thursday at 8 p.m. $40. Johnny Winter, Edgar Winter Band and Rick Derringer Band, jazz and blues. Friday at 7 p.m. $25 to $55. Buddy Guy, singer-songwriter and guitarist. April 7 at 8 p.m. $20 to $50. Count Basie Theater, 99 Monmouth Street. (732) 842-9000. Trenton Johnny Winter, Edgar Winter Band and Rick Derringer Band, jazz and blues. April 7 at 7:30 p.m. $30 to $50. Patriots Theater at the War Memorial, Memorial Drive. (609) 984-8400. West Orange D. Z. Vibe, blues. April 7, 9:30 p.m. to 1:30 a.m. No cover. Franklin Tavern, 97 Franklin Avenue. (973) 325-9899.
SPOKEN WORD
Newark Garrison Keillor, author and humorist. April 1 at 3 p.m. $22 to $68. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street. (888) 466-5722.
THEATER

Freehold ''On Golden Pond,'' drama by Ernest Thompson. Through April 1. $22 and $24. Center Playhouse, 35 South Street. (732) 462-9093. Leonia ''Starting Here, Starting Now,'' musical by David Shire and Richard Maltby Jr.; presented by the Players Guild of Leonia. Through April 1. $18 and $20. Civil War Drill Hall Theater, 130 Grand Avenue. (201) 947-9606. Millburn ''Romance/Romance,'' musical by Barry Harman and Keith Herrmann. Through April 1. $19 to $68. Paper Mill Playhouse, 3 Brookside Drive. (973) 376-4343. Montvale ''Jesus Christ Superstar: A Broadway Star Concert,'' songs from the musical by Andrew Lloyd Webber; with Danny Zolli, Bob Cuccioli, Shayna Steele and other Broadway performers. Through April 1. $40. St. Joseph Regional High School, 40 Chestnut Ridge Road. (201) 391-3300. Morristown ''The Fresh Aire Music of Mannheim Steamroller,'' multimedia concert. Thursday at 8 p.m. $52 to $75. The Community Theater, 100 South Street. (973) 539-8008. Oaklyn ''Much Ado About Nothing,'' Shakespeare's comedy; directed by Denise George. Through April 15. $17 to $30. Ritz Theater, 915 White Horse Pike. (856) 858-5230. Oradell ''Angels in America: Millennium Approaches,'' drama by Tony Kushner, presented by the Bergen County Players. Through April 21. $15 and $18. Little Firehouse Theater, 298 Kinderkamack Road. (201) 261-4200. Princeton ''Radio Golf,'' drama by August Wilson. Through April 8. $33 to $53. McCarter Theater Center, 91 University Place. (609) 258-2787.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Cape May ''Small Towns, Black Lives: African American Communities in New Jersey,'' photography by Wendel A. White. Through May 13. $1 and $2. Mid-Atlantic Center for the Arts, 1048 Washington Street. (609) 884-5404. Clifton '' Kaleidoscope,'' exhibition and sale; presented by the Clifton Association of Artists. Through April 14. $1. Clifton Arts Center, 900 Clifton Avenue. (973) 472-5499. Clinton ''Barbara Klein: New Marks,'' abstract paintings, and ''How American Women Artists Invented Post Modernism,'' group show presented by the Feminist Art Project. April 8 through June 3. Reception: April 15, 2 to 4 p.m. Donation: $3. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Hunterdon Museum of Art, 7 Lower Center Street. (908) 735-8415. Clinton ''Civil War Days,'' with re-enactments, exhibitions and tours. Through April 1. $5 to $9. Red Mill Museum Village, 56 Main Street. (908) 735-4101. Cranford ''Memories and Mountains,'' mixed-media by Carole Wong Chesak. Through April 20. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays and Saturdays, 1 to 4 p.m. Additional hours: Tuesdays through Thursdays, 6 to 9 p.m. Tomasulo Gallery, Union County College, 1033 Springfield Avenue. (908) 709-7155. Demarest ''Obsession Obsession,'' mixed-media group show. Through Thursday. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Art School at Old Church, 561 Piermont Road. (201) 767-7160. Hamilton ''New Jersey Perspective,'' photography by Owen Kanzler and sculpture by Kate Graves. Through April 8. $1 to $12. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m., April through October; 10 a.m. to 6 p.m., November through March. Grounds for Sculpture, 18 Fairgrounds Road. (609) 586-0616. Hopewell ''The Intimacy of Flowers,'' photography by Tasha O'Neill. Through April 15. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Gallery 14, 14 Mercer Street. (609) 333-8511. Jersey City ''Homegirls,'' mixed-media group show. Through Wednesday. Free. New Jersey City University, visual arts building gallery, 100 Culver Avenue. (201) 200-3214. Lambertville ''Constructions and Reconstructions,'' mixed media and photography by Nancy Shill and John Treichler. Friday through April 29. Artist talk and demonstrations: April 7, 2 to 4 p.m. Reception: April 14, 6 to 9 p.m. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Artists' Gallery, 32 Coryell Street. (609) 397-4588. Lincroft Photographs from the collection of Brookdale Community College. Through April 22. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Monmouth Museum, Brookdale Community College, Newman Springs Road. (732) 747-2266. Maplewood ''Lisa Pressman: Mixed Media, Transitions and Processes.'' Through April 28. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Thursdays, noon to 8 p.m. Classic Design Framing, 168 Maplewood Avenue. (973) 762-5588. Montclair ''Dreaming of a Speech Without Words: The Painting and Early Objects of H. C. Westermann.'' Through May 27. $6 to $8. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Montclair Art Museum, 3 South Mountain Avenue. (973) 746-5555. Morristown ''Oil on Linen,'' paintings by David Moore. Through April 21. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, noon to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m. Simon Gallery, 48 Bank Street. (973) 538-5456. Newark ''Mi Puerto Rico: Master Painters of the Island 1780-1952,'' paintings by José Campeche, Francisco Oller and Miguel Pou. Through April 15. $3 and $7. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, noon to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m., October through June; noon to 5 p.m., July through September. The Newark Museum, 49 Washington Street. (973) 596-6493. Oceanville ''Spinning Worlds: Emerging Artists,'' works by Paul Santoleri and Carla Falb. ''Surface Rhythms,'' works by Bennett Bean and Barbara Bullock. Both through April 22. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Noyes Museum of Art, 733 Lily Lake Road. (609) 652-8848. Princeton ''History, Identity or None of the Above: Regarding African-American Art,'' mixed-media exhibition. Through May 13. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Princeton University Art Museum, Nassau and Witherspoon Streets. (609) 258-3788. Princeton ''Radiant Evocations,'' paintings by Sam Feinstein. Through April 14. The Jewish Center of Princeton, 453 Nassau Street. (609) 921-0100. Rahway ''High Fiber Content,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 20. Hours: Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 1 to 4 p.m.; Thursdays, 1 to 3 p.m. and 5 to 7 p.m. Arts Guild of Rahway, 1670 Irving Street. (732) 381-7511. Rahway ''The Way of the Cross: Passion of Christ,'' paintings by Jean Charlot. Through April 14. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, noon to 7 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Edge Art Gallery, 1575 Irving Street. (732) 669-0112. Ridgewood ''Paper and Petals,'' botanical artwork by Beth S. Murphy. Through Friday. Unitarian Society of Ridgewood, 113 Cottage Place. (201) 444-6225. Skillman Group show by the A-Team Artists of Trenton. Through May 6. Reception: April 1, 1 to 4 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Montgomery Center for the Arts, 124 Montgomery Road. (609) 921-3272. South Orange ''Cathexis: Art of Obsession,'' mixed-media group show. Through May 6. ''Poetry at Pierro,'' poetry readings and open mike: April 29, 2 to 4 p.m. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Pierro Gallery, 5 Mead Street. (973) 378-7755. Springfield ''Structures,'' photography by Sue Zwick. Through April 26. Hours: Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8:30 p.m.; Tuesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 3:30 p.m. Donald B. Palmer Museum, 66 Mountain Avenue. (973) 376-4930. Summit ''Repose,'' works by Lindsay Walt. Through April 11. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m. Domo Gallery, 447 Springfield Avenue. (908) 608-0079. Trenton ''Portrait of a College,'' paintings by Mel Leipzig. Through April 7. Artworks School and Gallery, 19 Everitt Alley. (609) 394-9436. Trenton ''Friends for the Marsh 2007,'' photography exhibition. Through April 21. Wood-fired ceramics and handmade paper and printmaking by Peter Callas and Margaret Kennard Johnson. Through April 22. Suggested admission $2 to $5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. The Trenton City Museum, Cadwalader Park. (609) 989-3632. Union ''As I See It,'' photography by Jane H. Rapp. Through June 13. Les Malamut Art Gallery, 1800 Morris Avenue. (908) 851-5450. Upper Montclair ''Narcissus,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 29. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. Saturdays 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. Gallery of Modern Symbolism, 594 Valley Road. Washington Township ''In the Shadows of Manhattan,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 22. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.; Fridays, 6 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Sundays, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Atrium Gallery, Bergen County Y, 605 Pascack Road. (201) 666-6610, Extension 222.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
